page.title: 09Fruit Farms in Brightwell
page.content: Brightwell is a good area for growing fruit. Around the village there are several fruit farms. Sheard's fruit farm is one we visited and we spoke to Paul Sheard. He told us they grew 25 tons of cherries, strawberries, rasberries, loganberries, gooseberries, plums, greengages, apples and pears. The farm also sells direct to the public and the farm shop is open all year round. The busiest time is during the summer when they have P.Y.O. weekends. Then people who are going to buy the fruit pick it themselves from the bushes and trees. The farm employs 2 or 3 full time workers and some casual soft fruit pickers in the summer. It's a long day from 8am to 5pm in winter and 5am to 8pm in summer with only time to stop for a few cups of coffee during the day.
